description:
BASIC PURPOSE: This role will negotiate and maintain a roster of new & existing, world-class luxury brand partnerships and sponsorships for Regent Seven Seas Cruises, the world's leading luxury cruise line. The role will be responsible for a sustainable new luxury partnership division, building solid long-term relationships and generating exciting and appealing partner campaigns with a strong return on marketing investment. This is a key business development role in the organization, accountable for the delivery of brand awareness, lead generation and revenue, working across multiple internal & external stakeholders.

POSITION RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Provide account management to existing partners to ensure that agreements are properly executed to drive maximum value.
• Manage global budget for Partnership and Sponsorship initiatives.
• Work with Analytics and Research teams to analyze success of Brand and Partnerships and sponsorship activity and recommend optimizations for the future.
• Partner with key stakeholders to become an expert in our target audience and brand positioning within the marketplace.
• Identify core strengths and white-space opportunities to guide marketing strategic planning. Help identify and prioritize future partnership opportunities.
• Lead consumer marketing event and activation planning, execution and reporting.
• Centralize brand and messaging priorities across marketing (and non-marketing) stakeholders to ensure cohesive efforts across all consumer touchpoints.
• Work with internal and external agencies to oversee creation of 360 campaign materials across all channels.
• Provide assessment and POVs for potential new partnerships and loyalty marketing programs that drive incremental demand, source new revenue and support business strategies.
• Use analytics to monitor and drive performance of all Booked Guest Campaigns.
• Actively monitor industry and competitive trends in the marketplace for Programs in scope of role. Stay abreast of the competitive landscape within Cruise and Travel categories, making recommendations where appropriate.
• Work with teams across NCLH on commercialization of existing brand loyalty programs.
• Perform other job-related functions as assigned.

KNOWLEDGE AND EXPERIENCE:

EDUCATION: Bachelor's Degree in Business or Marketing

EXPERIENCE: Minimum 7 years' experience in Brand and/or Partnerships; preferably with Account Management expertise.

KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:
• Excellent written, verbal and oral communications skills required.
• Entrepreneurial focused and desire to create opportunities, grow businesses and exceed expectations.
• Firm grasp on the principles of brand strategy and management to deliver on business objectives.
• Solid knowledge of customer relationship management (CRM) strategy.
• Strong quantitative & analytical skills.
• Strong decision-making skills.
• Ability to work effectively in cross-functional team environment to accomplish goals and complete projects.
• Ability to find creative solutions during complex technical constraints.
• Significant experience developing and structuring presentations, as well as strong command of Excel.
• Strong critical thinking skills with ability to assess multiple inputs and develop a strategic recommendation.
• Strong, proven organization, attention to detail and project management skills.
• Ability to work in fast paced environment and manage multiple priorities at once.
• Comfort with both thinking strategically and carrying out specific tasks efficiently to move operations forward.
• This position may require being the organizer and point person and/or attending evening and weekend sponsorship/partnership events.

To Executive Search Firms & Staffing Agencies: NCLH does not accept unsolicited resumes from any agencies. All unsolicited resumes will be considered NCLH property, and NCLH will not be obligated to pay a referral fee. This includes resumes submitted directly to Hiring Managers without contacting the NCLH Human Resources Talent Acquisition Department.
